name: Estadio Nacional
club_use: Hosts major Chilean matches and events.
legacy: Still used today for big games and concerts.
fun_fact: It hosted the 1962 World Cup final where Brazil defended their title.

name: Wembley Stadium (old)
club_use: Demolished and replaced by the new Wembley in the 2000s.
legacy: The twin towers became a symbol of English football history.
fun_fact: England lifted their first and only World Cup here in 1966.

name: Estadio Azteca
club_use: Home to Club América and Mexico’s national team.
legacy: One of the few stadiums to host two World Cup finals (1970 and 1986).
fun_fact: Pelé and Maradona both created history on this pitch in different tournaments.

name: Olympiastadion
club_use: Former home of Bayern Munich, now used for events.
legacy: Its sweeping roof design became a famous architectural landmark.
fun_fact: West Germany beat the Netherlands here to win the 1974 World Cup.

name: Estadio Monumental
legacy: Regularly hosts Argentina’s biggest home matches.
fun_fact: The stands shook with noise when Argentina won the final here.

name: Santiago Bernabéu
legacy: Continues to be one of the most famous stadiums in the world.
fun_fact: Italy beat West Germany 3–1 here to lift their third World Cup.

name: Estadio Azteca
club_use: Home to Club América and Mexico’s national team.
legacy: Hosted both Maradona’s 'Hand of God' and 'Goal of the Century' in the same match.
fun_fact: It remains one of the loudest and most intimidating stadiums in the world.

name: Stadio Olimpico
legacy: Has hosted World Cups, European finals and Olympic events.
fun_fact: West Germany beat Argentina here in a tense 1–0 final.

name: Rose Bowl
club_use: Used mainly for American football and events.
legacy: Still one of the largest stadiums in the United States.
fun_fact: The 1994 World Cup final went to penalties under the California sun.

name: Stade de France
legacy: Has hosted rugby, athletics and football finals.
fun_fact: France lifted their first World Cup here with a 3–0 win over Brazil.

name: International Stadium Yokohama
club_use: Used for football and major events.
legacy: Hosts the Club World Cup and other international matches.
fun_fact: Ronaldo scored twice here as Brazil beat Germany in the 2002 final.

name: Olympiastadion Berlin
legacy: A historic stadium modernised for 21st-century football.
fun_fact: Zidane’s final match for France — and his famous headbutt — happened here.

name: Soccer City (FNB Stadium)
club_use: Kaizer Chiefs and South Africa national team matches.
legacy: Still hosts big games, concerts and national events.
fun_fact: Its outside is designed to look like a traditional African calabash pot.

name: Maracanã
club_use: Used by Rio clubs and the Brazil national team.
legacy: One of the most iconic football stadiums in the world.
fun_fact: Has hosted two World Cup finals, in 1950 and 2014.

name: Luzhniki Stadium
club_use: Hosts major Russian and international matches.
legacy: Modernised to become a multi-purpose sports arena.
fun_fact: France beat Croatia 4–2 here in a rain-soaked, dramatic final.

name: Lusail Iconic Stadium
club_use: Planned to be partly repurposed for community use after the World Cup.
legacy: Central to Qatar’s World Cup legacy plans with flexible seating.
fun_fact: It hosted the unforgettable 3–3 final between Argentina and France.
